materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Guava (0625) 1 ball
Minty (0520) 1 ball
Oatmeal (0326) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
gauge: 12 dc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes
• Each coaster is worked in joined rounds from the center outwards.
• For a set of six coasters, make two coasters in each of the three yarn colors.
COASTER
Make a slip knot and place it on the hook.

Chain 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.

1st rnd: Chain 3 (counts as first dc), work 2 double crochet (dc) in ring, [chain 3, work 3 double crochet in ring] three times, chain 3; join with slip st in top of beginning chain-3 – you will have four groups of 3-dc each with chain-3's between the groups.

2nd rnd: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same (first) ch-3 space (first corner made), * work (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space (next corner made); repeat from * 2 more times; join with slip st in top of beginning chain-3 –Four (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) corners.

3rd rnd: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3, work (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same (first) corner ch-3 space, work 3 dc in the next space between 3-dc groups, * work (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next corner ch-3 space, work 3 dc in the next space between 3-dc groups; repeat from * 2 more times; join with slip st in top of beginning chain-3 –Four (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) corners and one 3-dc group along each side of square between corners.

4th rnd: Slip st in next 2 dc, slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3, work (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same (first) corner ch-3 space, work 3 dc in each of the next 2 spaces between 3-dc groups, * work (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next corner ch-3 space, work 3 dc in each of the next 2 spaces between 3-dc groups; repeat from * 2 more times; join with slip st in top of beginning chain-3 – Four (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) corners and two 3-dc group along each side of square between corners.

Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using yarn needle, weave in yarn tails.

materials: lily® sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball
Contrast B hot Green (01712) or Yellow (00010) or hot orange (01628) 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Coaster
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *2 sc in each sc around. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. Break A.
9th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
Fasten off.
FiNisHiNG
With A, embroider segment lines on coaster using Back Stitch as seen in picture.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 196 Cardinal Red, 422 Golden Yellow, 431 Pumpkin, 494 Victory Red, 449 Forest Green, 484 Myrtle Green
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75mm [US C-2]
Stitch marker, yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Coaster measures 5.5” (14 cm) in diameter. Motif measures 3” (8 cm) long (including stem) x 2” (5 cm) wide.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this design.
instructions:
First Motif
Round 1 (Right Side):  Starting with adjustable ring, work (4 sc, 4 dc, 4 sc) in ring; insert st marker – 12 sts.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts – 24 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 2 times, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 2 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, [2 tr in next st, tr in next st] 2 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 2 times, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 2 times – 36 sts.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 2 times, 2 hdc in next st, picot in next st, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, tr in next st, (tr, picot, tr) in next st, tr in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, picot in next st, 2 hdc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times – 48 sts.
Round 5 (Stem): Ch 5, work 3 sc in second ch from hook, slip st in next 3 chs, slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
Remaining Motifs
Work 4 additional Motifs, joining on side adjacent to previous Motif and joining last Motif on two sides, following Assembly Diagram as a guide for placement.
Rounds 1-3: Work same as for First Motif.
1-Sided Joining
Round 4 (Joining Round): [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 2 times, 2 hdc in next st, picot, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, tr in next st, (tr, picot, tr) in next st, tr in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, joining picot, 2 hdc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times – 48 sts.
Coaster measures 5.5” (14 cm) in diameter.
Motif measures 3” (8 cm) long (including stem) x 2” (5 cm) wide.
Notes
1. Motifs are working in a continuous spiral. Do not join or turn unless otherwise indicated. Place a stitch marker in the first stitch and move up as work progresses.
2. Motifs are joined while working Rounds 4 and 5, using a join-as-you-go technique, following Assembly Diagram for placement.
Special Stitches
adjustable ring = Holding the yarn a few inches from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working yarn. Chain one to secure the loop, and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
picot = Ch 3, slip stitch in first ch, slip stitch in indicated stitch.
jointing picot = Ch 3, insert hook in first ch and in corresponding picot of previous Motif (see Assembly Diagram), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook, slip stitch in top of indicated stitch on current Motif.
2-Sided Joining
Round 4 (Joining Round): [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 2 times, 2 hdc in next st, joining picot, hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, tr in next st, (tr, picot, tr) in next st, tr in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st, joining picot, 2 hdc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 2 times – 48 sts.
Round 5 (Stem Joining Round): Ch 4, insert hook through 3 sc group of stems of all adjoining Motifs and work slip st, 3 sc in next ch, slip st in next 3 chs; join with slip st in next sc on Motif. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block.

pattern_name: Spiderweb Coasters and Halloween Table Center
materials: Coats® Crème de la Crème®: 2 balls 101 Creme A, 252 Brite Orange B, balls 12 Black C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0 mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: FPhdc = front post half double crochet
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Coaster measures 4.5” x 5” (11.4 x 12.7 cm). Table Topper measures 16” x 18” (40.6 x 45.7 cm).
gauge: Spider web square is 4.5” (11.4 cm) wide x 5” (12.7 cm) high. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
For Spider web Coaster: With A work Spider web Block. With either B or C, work 1 rnd in sc and 1 rnd in hdc as for table center block. With C, embroider spider. Weave in ends.
Skeleton Border: 
Rnd 1: With right side facing, join A in any corner, ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc), *FPhdc, hdc in next st, ch 2, skip 1, sc in next stitch, ch 2, skip 1, hdc in next stitch; repeat from * around, join with slip st to top of beginning ch 2.
Rnd 2: 2 hdc in hdc, *FPdc, 2 hdc in hdc, slip st in ch-2 space, ch 3, slip st in ch-2 space, 2 hdc in hdc; repeat from * around, join with slip st to beginning hdc. Fasten off. With C, embroider skull faces as shown. Weave in ends.
SPIDERWEB SQUARE
Ch 26.
Row 1: Dc in 8th ch from hook, *(ch 2, skip 2 ch, dc in next ch); repeat from * a total of 6 times. Ch 5, turn.
Row 2: Dc in next dc, *ch 4, skip space, tr in next dc; repeat from * a total of 4 times, ch 2, skip space, dc in dc, ch 2, skip space, dc in 3rd turning ch. Ch 5, turn.
Row 3: Dc in next dc, *ch 4, sc in tr; repeat from * a total of 4 times, ch 4, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip space, dc in next dc. Ch 5, turn.
Rows 4-7: Dc in next dc, *ch 4, sc in sc; repeat from * a total of 4 times, ch 4, skip space, dc in dc, ch 2, dc in 3rd turning ch. Ch 5, turn.
Row 8: Dc in next dc, *ch 2, tr in sc; repeat from * a total of 4 times, ch 2, skip space, dc in dc, ch 2, dc in 3rd turning ch. Ch 5, turn.
Row 9: Dc in next dc, *ch 2, dc in tr; repeat from * a total of 4 times, ch 2, dc in dc, ch 2, dc in 3rd turning ch. Cut yarn and fasten off.
Halloween Table Center
Make 5 Spiderweb blocks in A and 4 in B. Using C, join yarn in any space and sc around, working 3 sc in each corner. Work a round of hdc in each sc, working 3 hdc in each corner. Fasten off.
Note: One side of block has 7 spaces and one side has 8 spaces. Blocks should be oriented with the 8 space ends along the side when joining.
Assemble rows as follows: Rows 1 and 3: B, A, B. Row 2: A, B, A. Join rows. Embroider spider in center of A blocks as shown.
Spider Embroidery: Using C and yarn needle, secure on the wrong side and bring needle up at 1. Following diagram, make 4 parallel.

materials: Aunt Lydia™ Cozy 3 (170 yds/154 m)
Contrast A Light Tourmaline (6260) 1 ball
Contrast B Yellow (7330) 1 ball
Contrast C Flamingo (1470) 1 ball
Contrast D Icy Blue (4310) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
Note: To join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Coaster
Using 2 strands
1st rnd: 6 sc into a magic ring. Join (6 sc). Video here.
2nd rnd: 2 sc into each sc around. Join. (12 sc)
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (18 sc)
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (24 sc)
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (30 sc)
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (36 sc)
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (42 sc)
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (48 sc)
9th rnd: Ch 1. (Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. Join. (54 sc)
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, skip 2 sc just made. Sl st in first sc of rnd. Ch 1. 6 dc in ch-4 sp - first Reverse Wave made. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 4. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, skip 2 sc just made and working behind First Reverse Wave, sl st in ch-4 sp of First Reverse Wave (after last dc). Ch 1. 6 dc in ch-4 sp - second Reverse Wave made. Rep from * 16 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. (18 Reverse Waves).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White (A) and 312 Black (B)
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 14 sts and 15 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 14: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 11 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, dc2tog over next 2 sts; turn, leaving turning ch unworked – 15 sts.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 11 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts; turn – 13 sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 9 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts; turn – 11 sts.
Rows 17–25: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in st across; turn – 10 sts.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in each of next 8 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts; turn – 9 sts.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st; turn – 9 sts.
Row 29: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 6 sts, sc2tog over last 2 sts; turn – 9 sts.
Row 30: Ch 1, sc2tog, 1 sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st; turn – 9.
Row 31: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 4 sts, [sc2tog over next 2 sts] twice, do not fasten off or turn – 8 sts.
Edging: Ch 1, rotating piece to work across side edge, sc evenly around entire piece, working 3 sc at very top and bottoms points; join with slip st in first sc.
FINISHING: With yarn needle and B and using photograph as a guide for placement, embroider 2 French knots for eyes; embroider satin stitches over 2 rows for an oval-shaped mouth.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
GHOST (make 4): Starting at top of head, with A, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn –1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in st, turn – 2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st; turn – 3 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of last 2 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sts, 2 sc in last st; turn – 5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each of last 4 sts; turn – 6 sc.
Rows 7–9: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 2 sts, sc2tog over next 2 sts; turn – 4 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, ch 10; turn – 4 sc and ch-10.
Row 12: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each of next 2 ch, hdc in each of next 3 ch, sc in last ch, sc in next 4 sts, ch 10; turn – 12 sts and ch-10.
Row 13: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in each of next 2 ch, hdc in each of next 3 ch, sc in last ch, sc in next 7 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, dc2tog over next 2 sts; turn, leaving turning ch unworked – 18 sts.

materials: AUNT LYDIA'S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each of 001 White A, 397 Wasabi B, 494 Victory Red C, and 484 Myrtle Green D
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5 mm [US 7]
Thread needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 32 sts = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DOILY – VERSION 1
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in next sc, *ch 1, dc in next sc; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—24 dc and 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in same ch-1 space, 2 dc in each remaining ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—48 dc.
Remove loop of A from hook, enlarge the loop so that it does not unravel and drop it to the wrong side of piece. Do not cut A. You will pick up and use A again later.
Round 5 (right side): With right side facing, join B with sc in any dc, 2 sc in next dc, *sc in next dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Fasten off B. Return dropped loop of A to hook.
Round 6: With A, slip st in closest sc of Round 5, ch 1, sc in same sc, *ch 9, skip next 11 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last 11 sc, ch 9, skip last 11 sc; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 ch-9 spaces.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, (5 dc, ch 2, 5 dc) in next ch-9 space, *sc in next sc, (5 dc, ch 2, 5 dc) in next ch-9 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 (5 dc, ch 2, 5 dc) groups.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *sc in next 2 dc, dc in next 3 dc, (2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr) in next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc, sc in next 2 dc **, sc in next sc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc, 36 dc and 6 (2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr) groups (6 points).
Fasten off A.
Round 9 (right side): With right side facing, join C with sc in any ch-2 space, 2 sc in same ch-2 space. sc in each st to next ch-2 space, *3 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in each st to next ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—108 sc.
Fasten off C.
Round 10 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first sc of 3-sc group at tip of any point, *ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook (picot made), skip next sc, sc in next 7 sc, sc3tog **, sc in next 7 sc; repeat from * to last 6 sc ending last repeat at **, sc in last 6 sc; join with slip st in first sc—90 sc and 6 picot.
Fasten off A.
Round 11 (right side): With right side facing, join D with sc in sc immediately before any picot, *ch 4, skip picot, sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next 3 sc, tr in next 5 sc, dc in next 3 sc **, ch 1, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—78 sts, 12 ch-1 spaces, and 6 ch-4 spaces (2 sc, 6 dc, 5 tr and 2 ch-1 spaces between ch-4 spaces).
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *5 sc in next ch-4 space, sc in next sc, hdc in next ch-1 space, hdc in next 4 sts, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts, hdc in next ch-1 space **, sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—126 sts (21 sts along each of 6 sides).
Fasten off D.
Round 13 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in center sc of 5-sc group at tip of any point, ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st, hdc in next 5 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—147 hdc.
Fasten off B.
Round 14 (right side): With right side facing, join C with sc in any hdc, sc in next 5 hdc, 2 sc in next hdc, *sc in next 6 hdc, 2 sc in next hdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—168 sc.
Round 15: *Ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook (picot made), skip next sc, slip st in next 2 sc; repeat from * around—56 picots.
Fasten off C.
DOILY – VERSION 2
Make same as Doily – Version 1, using A for Rounds 1–4, C for Round 5, A for Rounds 6–8, D for Round 9, A for Round 10, B for Rounds 11 and 12, C for Round 13 and D for Rounds 14 and 15.
DOILY – VERSION 3
Make same as Doily – Version 1, using A for Rounds 1–4, D for Round 5, A for Rounds 6–8, B for Round 9, A for Round 10, C for Rounds 11 and 12, D for Round 13, and B for Rounds 14 and 15.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Gently steam press to block.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 21 yds/19 m
Contrast B Jute (00082) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 17 yds/15 m
Contrast D Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 37 yds/33 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Susan Bates® stitch marker
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
measurements: Coasters: Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter. Plant Pot: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] diameter x 2½" [6 cm] tall when folded.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
COASTERS
Center (Make 3 each with A and B.)  See diagram on page 2.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 6 times more. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 6 times more. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc. Fasten off.
Outer (Work with B on A Centers and C on B Centers)
Join corresponding color with sl st to back loop of any sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 scbl in same sp as sl st. (1 scbl in each of next 3 sc. 2 scbl in next sc) 7 times. 1 scbl in each of last 3 sc. Join. 40 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 5. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 3 ch - Stem made. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sl st in each of next 4 sc. *(2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. 2 hdc in next sc.** 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) all in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to ** once more. 1 sl st in each of last 4 sc. Join. Fasten off.
PLANT POT
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. PM at end of rnd. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. 40 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked row measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off. Fold top ½" [1.25 cm] to RS as seen in picture.

pattern_name: Luck of the Irish Crochet Coasters
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 19.5 yds [17.5 m]
Contrast B Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 13 yds [12 m]
Contrast C Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball or 13 yds [12 m]
Contrast D Black (00002) 1 ball or 2 yds [1.5 m]
Contrast E Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 1 yd [.9 m]
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc. Face With A, ch 3. 1st rnd: (RS) 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc. 3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 5 times more. 2 hdc in next hdc. Break A. Join B. With B, *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. 30 hdc. Do not fasten off. Hat Note: Hat is worked in rows. 1st row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. Rep 3rd row once more. Fasten off. Beard 1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to 1st unworked st of Face after Hat. *2 dc in next st. 1 sl st in next st. Rep from * 9 more times. Fasten off. FINISHING With D and E, embroider Eyes, Mouth, and Hat Details as shown in picture.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Baker’s Cotton: 1 ball each 700 Pink A, 621 Green B, 529 Turquoise C, 565 Purple D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8].
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: One coaster measures about 4 x 4” (10 x 10cm) square.
gauge: Use finished measurements for gauge. GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL FOR THIS PROJECT.
instructions:
COASTER
(make 4 – 1 each with A, B, C, and D)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in ring, [ch 2, dc in ring] 6 times, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—8 dc and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, beg-V-st) in first ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space, [ch 3, V-st in next ch-2 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, ch 3; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—4 V-sts, 8 ch-3 spaces, and 4 sc.
Round 3: (Slip st, beg-V-st) in ch-2 space of beg-V-st, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice, *ch 3, V-st in ch-2 space of next V-st, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] twice; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 3; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—4 V-sts, 12 ch-3 spaces, and 8 sc.
Round 4: (Slip st, beg-corner) in ch-2 space of beg-V-st, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, shell in next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, corner in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—4 corners, 8 ch-3 spaces, 4 shells, and 8 sc.
Round 5: Slip st in next dc, (slip st, beg-shell) in ch-2 space of beg-corner, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, shell in ch-2 space of next corner, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in 3rd dc of next shell, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 2 more times, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—4 shells, 16 ch-3 spaces, and 12 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block into shape if needed.
Special Stitches
beg-V-st (beginning V-stitch) = Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in indicated space.
V-st (V-stitch) = (Dc, ch 2, dc) in indicated space.
beg-shell (beginning shell) = Ch 3 (counts as dc), 4 dc in indicated space.
shell = 5 dc in indicated space.
beg-corner (beginning corner) = Ch 3 (counts as dc), (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated space.
corner = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated space.
Note
Each coaster is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times. Do not turn at the end of rounds.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 319 Cherry Red and 706 Perfect Pink
Susan Bates® Crochet hook: 5mm [H-8]
Stitch markers
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: 5” wide x 5 ¼” tall (12.7 cm wide x 13.3 cm tall)
gauge: 4 sc = 1” (2.5 cm); 4 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, skip sl st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts*, repeat from * to * twice, 2 sc in next st, sc in ends of next 11 rows, (sc, ch 2, sc) in beginning ch at point, turn 90 degrees to work along next side, sc in ends of next 11 rows, skip slip st, repeat from * to * 3 times, 2 sc in next st, ch 1, skip next st, slip st in end of Row 1 of First Hump—52 sc, 1 ch-2 space.
Row 2: Ch 1, do not turn, skip slip st, reverse sc in first sc, reverse sc in each st around to ch space, reverse sc in ch space, reverse sc in each remaining sc around, ch 1, sl st in end of Row 1 of Second Hump—53 reverse sc. 
Fasten off.
Finishing
Weave in ends.
Special Stitch
Reverse Single Crochet (reverse sc): Without turning work, insert hook in st to right of hook, yo, pull up loop, yo, pull thru both loops on hook.
Pattern Note
Place marker in center ch-2 space of mitered square moving up to new ch-2 space as each row is completed.
COASTER (Make 1 in each color)
Mitered Square
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in 2nd ch from hook, place marker in ch-2 space—2 sc, 1 ch-2 space.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next st, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space, sc in next st—4 sc, 1 ch-2 space.
Rows 3–10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across to marked ch-2 space, (sc, ch 2, sc) in marked ch-2 space, sc in each remaining st across—20 sc, 1 ch-2 space at end of last row.
First Hump
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sts, skip next 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, sc in ch-2 space—6 sc, 5 dc.
Row 2: Turn, skip next 3 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, 2 dc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, slip st in next st—11 dc. Fasten off.
Second Hump
Row 1: With Right Side facing, join with sc in marked ch-2 space, sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, 5 dc in next st, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts—6 sc, 5 dc.
Row 2: Rep row 2 from First Hump—11 dc. Do not fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 ball 368 321 Gold or 376 Burgundy
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
Four ½” beads per coaster
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 12 sc = 4”; 15 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COASTER
Ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 4th ch from hook, [dc in next ch, sc in next ch] 4 times, dc in last ch.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, [sc in next sc, dc in next dc] 4 times, sc in next sc, dc in top of beginning ch.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 3” from beginning.
Edging Round: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1), turn, [hdc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times across to last st, (hdc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, hdc) all in last st, turn to work along side edge, [ch 1, hdc] 4 times evenly spaced along edge, ch 1, turn to work opposite foundation ch, (hdc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, hdc) all in first st, ch 1, [hdc in next dc, ch 1] 4 times across to last st, (hdc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, hdc) all in last st, turn to work along side edge, [ch 1, hdc] 4 times evenly spaced along edge, ch 1, (hdc, ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook) in same space as beginning ch, ch 1, slip st to 2nd ch of beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. For corner tassels, thread two strands of yarn into yarn needle. Insert into corner, thread all four ends through bead, knot ends close to bead. Trim ends.

pattern_name: May Flowers Hot Pad & Coaster Set
materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® 'Classic Crochet Thread': 1 ball each of White A, 487 Dark Royal B, 421 Goldenrod C, 431 Pumpkin D, 484 Myrtle Green E, 493 French Rose F, and 494 Victory Red G.
Crochet Hooks: 1.65mm [US 7] and 1.30mm [US 10].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F, G = color A, B, C, D, E, F, G
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hot pad measures 6” wide x 5½” high. Coaster measures 4” wide x 3¾” high.
gauge: 11 (dc, ch 2) mesh = 3”; 4 mesh rows = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: HOT PAD Foundation Mesh With smaller hook and A, ch 62. Row 1 (right side): Dc in 8th ch from hook, [ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch] 18 times; turn—19 open mesh. Rows 2-19: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), [skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 2] 18 times, skip next 2 chs, dc in next ch; turn. Fasten off. NOTE: Foundation Mesh should measure 5 ¼” wide x 4¾” high when complete and will stretch when design area is worked. Design Area With right side facing, using larger hook, join B with slip st in last ch-2 space on Row 1 (dot on chart in bottom left corner), ch 3, 3 dc in same ch-2 space, follow arrow around to dot, working 8 dc in ch-5 corner spaces and 4 dc around each dc post and in each ch-2 space; join with a slip st in top of ch-3. Fasten off. AUNT LYDIA’S® ‘Classic Crochet Thread’, Size 10, Art. 154 available in white and ecru 400 yd (368 m) and solid color 350 yd (322 m) and shaded color 300 yd (276 m) balls. ABBREVIATIONS: A, B, C, D, E, F, G = color A, B, C, D, E, F, G; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; st(s) = stitch(es); [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified Work other sections in same manner, starting at dot and following arrow around to dot in this order: 1.Large flowers in C and G 2. Small flowers in D and F 3. Leaves in E 4. Background in A Work center of flowers with thread color as per chart as follows: Join with slip st around dc post as shown by dot on chart, ch 2, working in direction indicated by arrow, 3-dc cluster around same dc post, 4-dc cluster in next ch-2 sp, 4-dc cluster around next dc post, 4-dc cluster in next ch-2 space; join with slip st in first cluster. Fasten off. Weave in ends. COASTER SET Foundation Mesh With smaller hook and A, ch 44 Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 8th ch from hook, [ch 2, skip next 2 chs, dc in next ch] 12 times; ch 5, turn – 13 open mesh. Rows 2-13: [Skip next 2 chs, dc in next dc, ch 2] 12 times, skip next 2 chs, dc in next ch; ch 5, turn. At end of Row 13, do not ch 5. Fasten off. NOTE: Mesh will measure 3 ½” wide x 3 ¼” high when complete and will stretch when design area is worked as follows: Design Area (Use larger hook throughout) Join B with slip st in ending ch-5 space on Row 12 (dot on chart in top right corner), ch 3, 7 dc in same ch-5 space, follow arrow around to dot, working 4 dc around each dc post and in each ch-2 space and 8 dc in ch-5 corner space; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off. Work other sections in same manner, starting at dot and following arrow around to dot in this order: 1.Large flower in C 2. Small flower in F 3. Leaves in E 4. Background in A Work center of flowers with thread color as per chart as follows: Join with slip st around dc post as shown by dot on chart, ch 2, working in direction indicated by arrow, [yo, insert hook around same dc post and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] 3 times, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook – beginning dec made; [yo, insert hook in ch-2 space and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] 4 times, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook – dec made; work dec around next dc post and in next ch-2 space; join with slip st in beginning dec. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 2 balls Vanilla CA and 1 ball 1340 Almond CB for one set.
Crochet Hook: U.S. Size I-9 [5½mm].
abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Placemat measures 14” high x 19” wide. Coaster measures 5½” across.
gauge: Placemat Rnd 1 = 6” long x 1¼” wide. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
With CA ch 19. 
Rnd 1: 4 Dc in 4th ch from hook (ch-3 counts as dc), dc in next 14 ch, 5 dc in last ch, working on opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 14 sts; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 38 sts.
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 4 times, dc in next 14 dc, [2 dc in next dc] 5 times, dc in next 14 dc; join – 48 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 9 times, dc in next 14 dc, [2 dc in next dc] 10 times, dc in next 14 dc; join – 68 dc.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in same ch as joining, skip next dc, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with a sl st to first sc.
Rnd 5: Slip st into space, ch 1, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in space; repeat from * around; join.
Rnds 6 and 7: Rep Rnd 5.
Rnd 8: Sl st into sp, ch 1, 3 sc in space, * [ch 2, 3 sc in next space] 9 times, ch 2, [2 sc in next space] 7 times, ch 2 **, 3 sc in next space; repeat from * to **; join.
Rnd 9: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next 2 sc, * [3 dc in next sp, dc in next 3 sc] 9 times, 3 dc in next space, dc in next 14 sc, 3 dc in next space **, dc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to **; join.
Rnds 10 and 11: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join. Fasten off.
Rnd 12: Attach CB in same ch as joining. Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in same ch, skip next dc, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next dc, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join to first sc.
Rnds 13-15: Rep Rnd 5. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
COASTER
Rnd 1: With CA ch 4, 11 dc in 4th ch from hook; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 12 sts. 
Rnd 2: Ch 3, dc in same ch as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 24 sts.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, [2 dc in next dc] twice, * dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc] twice; repeat from * around; join – 40 sts. 
Fasten off.
Rnd 4: Attach CB in same ch as joining. Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) all in same ch, skip next dc, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in next dc, skip next dc; rep from * around; join to first sc.
Rnd 5: Slip st into space, ch 1, * (sc, ch 4, sc) all in space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 33 yds/30 m or 1 ball
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (01215) 66 yds/60 m or 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
With A, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See chart on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 24 sc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 32 sc. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 40 sc. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 48 sc. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. 56 sc. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 8 times. 64 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 4. Skip next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Ch 4. Skip last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: *Ch 1. (1 hdc. 4 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-4 sp. Ch 1. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. 16 petals.
11th rnd: Ch 2. *Working behind petals, 1 sc in next ch-4 sp between group of 4 dc. Ch 5. Rep from * around. Skip first ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 ch-5 sps.
12th rnd: *Ch 1. (1 hdc. 6 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-5 sp. Ch 1. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around.
13th rnd: Ch 4. *Working behind petals, 1 sc in next ch-5 sp between group of 6 dc. Ch 7. Rep from * around. Skip first ch-4 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 ch-7 sps.
14th rnd: *Ch 2. (5 dc. Ch 3. Sl st to top of last dc – picot made. 4 dc) in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 505 Aruba Sea A, 316 Soft White B, 319 Cherry Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Tapestry needle
Spray starch (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished measurements Snowflake Motif = 3 ½” (9 cm) in diameter
gauge: CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With desired color, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, ch 3, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in next st, skip next st, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space, *skip st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc—6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in each of next 2 sts, (slip st, [ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in each of next 2 ch, slip st in ch-3 space] twice in next ch-3 space, *skip next st, sc in each of next 3 sts, (slip st, [ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in each of next 2 ch, slip st in ch-3 space] twice in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Repeat using colors A, B and C for desired number of Snowflake Motifs.
Snowflake Motif Finishing
Wet finished motif, flatten & straighten snowflake spokes, allow to dry. For extra flattening, cover damp motif with waxed paper and place heavy book on top until motif is dry.
Optional: Spray with laundry starch to stiffen as desired.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004)
Contrast B Tea Rose (00042) or Country Yellow (01612) or Overcast (01042) or Ecru (00004)
1 ball or 9½ yds/9 m
1 ball or 6½ yds/6 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Craft cord (40" [101.5 cm] of 4.5 mm diameter cord is required per Coaster)
Stitch marker
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
Crochet around the craft cord as 
you work.
After set-up rnd, Coasters are 
worked in a spiral. Do not  join 
rnds, simply work directly into 
next st (noting marker to indicate 
end of rnd will move up each rnd).
Set-up rnd:  Measure 2" [5 cm] 
from end of craft cord and place 
marker on cord at this point. Join 
A  with sl st around cord at marker 
(this end will be sewn in place 
on WS during Finishing). Ch 1. 
Working around cord,  work 10 sc. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. Place 
marker on first sc worked. *2 sc in 
each sc around. 20 sc.
2nd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in 
next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
40 sc. If desired, break A to join 
Contrast B for edging or work 4th 
rnd with A.
4th rnd:  With B, *1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. 50 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc at end of rnd. Fasten off. 
Cut cord, leaving 2" [5 cm] tail end.
FINISHING
Secure ends of cord on WS, using 
either tail ends of yarn or sewing 
thread.

pattern_name: How to Crochet Coasters for Beginners
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast D Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast E Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast B Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast D Teal (01133) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast E Bright Navy (00009) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Chain (ch) 2 at beginning (beg) of rounds (rnds) does not count as half double crochet (hdc).
COASTER
Make 1 each with B, C, D, and E as Color 2.
With A, ch 3. 
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Repeat (rep) from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in first hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 sc in last hdc. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Contrast B Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast D Sunshine (00073) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Contrast E Tangerine (01699) 1 ball or 2 yds/1.5 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
gauge: 13 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as hdc.
COASTER
Make 1 each with B, C, D, and E as Color 2.
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join Color 2 with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. *2 sc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 sc in last hdc. Join A with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™Blend”: 3 balls 1340 Almond or 1105 Vanilla will make 1 placemat and coaster set.
Crochet Hook: U.S. Size G-6 [4mm].
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Placemat measures approximately 14” high x 17½” wide. Coaster measures 6” across.
gauge: 18 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
PLACEMAT
Ch 68.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 67 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next sc; * skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, dc in first skipped sc (insert hook from the front while keeping thread at the back of the work as usual – this second dc will enclose the first dc) – crossed double made; repeat from * to last 2 sc; dc in last 2 sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st and space across; sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until 33 rows in all are completed, end Row 3; do not turn at end of last row.
Border
Round 1: Ch 1, work 49 sc down side to corner, ch 2, work 67 sc across lower edge to next corner, ch 2, work 49 sc up next side to corner, ch 2, work 67 sc across top edge, ch 2; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 4, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to corner; ch 3, sc in ch-2 space **, ch 3, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 1, hdc in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc over hdc, ch 3, * sc in next space, ch 3; repeat from * around; join to first sc.
Round 4: Sl slip st in next space, ch 1, sc in same space; holding back last loop on hook, 2 dc in next space, yo and draw thread through all 3 loops on hook – cl (cluster) made; [ch 2, cl in same space] twice, * sc in next space, (cl, [ch 2, cl] twice) all in next space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
COASTER
Ch 14. Work same as Placemat over 13 sts for 9 rows. Work Border same as for Placemat working 13 sc across each side between ch-2 at corners on Round 1.

materials: RED HEART® Gumdrop®: 1 ball of 620 Cherry A
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of 2515 Turquoise B, and 9528 Lilac C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: Finished square = 4” x 4” (10 x 10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With first color, ch 4; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 2 dc in ring, *ch 3, 3 dc in ring; repeat from * twice, ch 3; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 12 dc; 4 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Round 2: Slip st in next 2 dc and ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-3 space, *(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * twice, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off if changing color.
Round 3: Slip st in next 2 dc and corner ch-3 space or join next color with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-3 space, *3 dc between next two 3-dc groups**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 4: Slip st in next 2 dc and ch-3 space, ch 3, (2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-3 space, *[3 dc between next two 3-dc groups] twice**, (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Color Sequence
Coaster #1: Rounds 1-4: B.
Coaster #2: Rounds 1-2: A. Rounds 3-4: B.
Coaster #3: Rounds 1-2: A. Rounds 3-4: C.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) 19.5 yds [17.5 m]
Contrast B Spring Green (0672) 13 yds [12 m]
Contrast C Carrot (0256) 13 yds [12 m]
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black yarn for eyes, mouth and hat embroidery
Susan Bates® yarn needle
gauge: 13 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds and rows does not count as hdc.
FACE
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS) 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 5 times more. 2 hdc in next hdc. Break A. Join B.
With B, *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
30 hdc.
Do not fasten off.
HAT
Note: Hat is worked in rows.
1st row: (WS). Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 hdc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd row once more. Fasten off.
BEARD
1st rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to 1st unworked st of Face after Hat.
*2 dc in next st. 1 sl st in next st. Rep from * 9 more times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With D and E, embroider Eyes, Mouth, and Hat Details as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Ombre or Stripes: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Lime Stripes (21712) or Mod Ombre (02223) 1 ball or 41 yds/37 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 14 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Cord is worked in foundation single crochet.
1st row: Place slip knot on hook. Ch 2. Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook (1 sc).
2nd row: Insert hook into ch at base of previous row and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Rep 2nd row until cord is 116" [295 cm] long. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Work Carrick Bend Mat knot shape (see video link below), with beg of cord at center and working 3 times around.
http://www.animatedknots.com/carrickmat/index.php
Carefully tighten knot until you are happy with the shape. If necessary, unravel a few rows from end of cord.
Sew cord edges tog with whipstitch along all loose edges.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast B Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast C Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast D Hot Purple (01317) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast E Red (00095) 1 ball or 17 yds/15.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.

Hearts (make 1 in each A, B, C, and D)
Ch 17.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 6 ch. Join.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Join.

4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Join.

5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join.

6th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Skip 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. (2 sc in next sc.1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 11 sc. Join.

Fasten off.

Embroidery: With E, follow embroidery chart using chain st to embroider letters as shown right. CUTIE XOXO BE MINE LOVE WINS

materials: Set of 4 Coasters
Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Hot Red (0390) 1 ball or 28 yds/26 m
Contrast B White (0311) 1 ball or 36 yds/33 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Coaster is worked in a spiral. Do not join rnds.
• Place marker on first st to mark beg of rnd and move marker up at start of each rnd as work progresses.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
COASTER
Beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: With A, 8 hdc in ring. 8 sts.
2nd rnd: *With A, 1 hdc in next st. With B, 1 hdc in same st just worked. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: *With A, 2 hdc in next st. With B, 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
4th rnd: *With A, 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st.** With B, 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Work from * to ** once more. With B, (1 hdc. 1 sc) in next st. 1 sc in last st. Break B. 48 sts.
5th rnd: With A, sl st in each of next 2 sts. Do not fasten off.
Finish with invisible join: Cut A, leaving approx 6" [15 cm] tail. Pull loop on hook up until tail passes through last st (no loops rem on hook). Thread tail onto yarn needle. Insert needle under top 2 loops of next st from front to back. Insert needle through back loop only of last sl st worked, from front to back. Pull gently to close gap and make tail look like st. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Minty (0520) 1 ball
Contrast B Delft Blue (0885) 1 ball
Contrast C Light Blue (0381) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. 5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle
Fabric stiffener
abbreviations: Invisible join = After last stitch in round is made, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull tail completely through last stitch. Thread the tail onto yarn needle and weave the end under the top 2 loops of the first stitch of the round and then back down into the center of the top of the last stitch of the round. Weave tail through wrong side of piece to first stitch to be sewn.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] from point to point, blocked and stiffened.
gauge: Point Motif: 2" [5 cm] wide x 2¾" long [7 cm].
instructions:
NOTE: Coaster is made of six points which are sewn together to make a star. Adjustable-ring method = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring, working over both strands (the tail and the ring). After the 2nd round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring. Do not close ring completely.

COASTER (make 1 each with A, B, and C)
Point Motif (make 6)
Make an adjustable ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. Ch 3. 1 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) in ring. Rep from * once. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sts and 2 ch-3 sps.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as first hdc. Ch 1). 1 hdc in first sc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. (2 hdc. Ch 3. 2 hdc) in next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts*. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next sc. Rep from * to * once. Join in top of beg ch with invisible join, leaving a long tail for sewing. 20 hdc. 2 ch-1 sps and 2 ch-3 sps. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring but do not close completely.

FINISHING
Arrange pieces with ch-3 sps at center and outer points. With RS of 2 motifs together, begin in nearest ch and working through both sets of loops, whipstitch in each st and ch across, ending in center ch of next ch-3 sp at center of Coaster. Secure and cut tail. Repeat to join each remaining motif to previous motif. Weave in ends. Block to finished measurement, stretching and pinning out outer ch-3 sps to accentuate each point and straighten edges. Spray with fabric stiffener.
